Application of new design principles to existing equipment is also an important element of continuous process safety improvement.  In addition, formal incident investigation procedures are in place so that causes of even the smallest failures are identified and corrected.

Continued training and planned drills will sustain and improve emergency response capabilities.

Over the past five (5) years, the following projects have improved the plant's overall safety and environmental processes.  These include: 

(1) Increased frequency of facility inspections in critical processing areas; (2) Leak Detection and Repair inspection frequency increased to quarterly for Hazardous Air Pollutants and (3) Increased requirements for the facility's behavioral-based auditing program (People Based Safety) which includes employees at all levels of the organization

This document was prepared as part of the Risk Management Program (RMP) for the OMNOVA Solutions Inc. Performance Chemicals Division plant located in Green Bay, Wisconsin.  The RMP conforms to the legal requirements established by the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA).  The purpose of the RMP plan is to:

1) Describe existing safety systems at the Green Bay Plant designed to protect employees, the community, the environment, and plant process.
2) Comply with applicable environmental laws and EPA regulations (Title 40, Part 68 of the Code of Federal Regulations).

The following executive summary as required in §68.155 presents an overview of the Green Bay facility's accident prevention and emergency response programs.

§68.155(a) ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE POLICIES

Commitment to Safety
OMNOVA Solutions Inc. and the Green Bay Plant are and always have been committed to safe operations.  We believe Safety is a value that comes first in everything we do.  This commitment begins with highly qualified people and is reflected at all levels of the organization.  All employees at the Green Bay Plant are provided with the training, tools, and authority to perform their duties in a safe manner.  Strict operational procedures and controls are in place to ensure safety from the conceptual stage through product development, manufacturing, handling and storage, and delivery to customers.  The Green Bay Plant has a staff of highly qualified safety and environmental professionals, engineers, and support personnel to assure implementation of, and an on-going commitment to, the highest standards of safe process management.  Their experience and professional competence have resulted in many years of safe operation which consistently exceed industry averages.

Responsible Care Policy
SAFETY, HEALTH, ENVIRONMENT & SECURITY
We, the employees at OMNOVA's Performance Chemicals Division, will operate our facilities and conduct our busines

yee safety programs, Responsible Care implementation, EPA's RMP requirements, and emergency response programs, make up OMNOVA's Accidental Release Prevention Program.  Safety systems in place at the Green Bay Plant include combustible gas sensors and alarms, automatic controls, automatic shutdown systems, early suppression fast response systems (i.e. deluge water systems, foam systems, etc.), secondary containment dikes and below-grade vaults, and employees specially trained in chemical handling and emergency response.

OMNOVA Solutions' overall safety efforts at the Green Bay Plant consist of measures to prevent the release of hazardous materials, as well as programs to mitigate the effects of an actual release should it occur.  The Green Bay Plant has a trained and properly equipped emergency response team capable of handling foreseeable emergency situations.  Importantly, coordination with local emergency response agencies is a key element of our emergency response planning process.  Specific plans are in place to respond to chemical emergencies involving RMP-regulated substances within the facility.

§68.155(d) FIVE-YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY

The EPA regulations require regulated facilities to provide information about all accidents in the last 5 years involving an RMP regulated substance if the accident resulted in (1) death, injury according to the RMP definition, or significant property damage on site, or (2) known deaths, injuries, property or environmental damage off site.  

No accidents meeting this regulatory definition have occurred at the Green Bay Plant within the last five years.

§68.155(e) PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY

Intrinsic safety is a key element in the design of all process equipment at OMNOVA Solutions' Green Bay Plant.  All changes to the covered processes are subject to a formal review through our Management of Change Program and all covered process equipment designs and modifications are subject to formal Process Hazards Ana

s activities in a manner that protects the safety and health of our employees, preserves and protects the environment and maintains effective security processes.

We are dedicated to developing, manufacturing, selling and transporting our products in a safe and environmentally responsible manner. We will communicate to our customers how to use, handle, store and dispose of our products responsibly.

We commit to comply with safety, health, environmental and security laws and regulations as well as those programs we have implemented as part of the Responsible Care Guiding Principles.

We will establish goals, objectives and processes to drive continual improvement of safety, health, environmental and security practices in our facilities.

Our business activities will be conducted in a way that promotes openness with stakeholders.

This policy reflects OMNOVA's ongoing commitment to our employees, shareholders, customers and communities.

§68.155(b) STATIONARY SOURCE DESCRIPTION AND REGULATED CHEMICALS HANDLED

Green Bay
The Green Bay Plant produces synthetic styrene-butadiene and styrene-butadiene-acrylonitrile polymer products used mainly in the paper, carpet and textile industries.  The RMP-regulated substances used to manufacture these products are 1,3-butadiene (CAS# 106-99-0), acrylonitrile (CAS# 107-13-1), and 28% ammonium hydroxide solution (CAS# 1336-21-6; 7664-41-7 as ammonia).  Acrylonitrile and 28% ammonium hydroxide solution are the regulated toxic substances on site; and 1,3-butadiene is the regulated flammable substance on site.  Finished products are non-hazardous and are in the form of a low-viscosity, milky-white liquid emulsion.  

§68.155(c) GENERAL ACCIDENTIAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM AND CHEMICAL SPECIFIC STEPS
